basic.description:
Study of the relationship between spatial pattern and ecological processes. Topics include spatial arrangement of ecosystems and its influence on the flow of energy, materials and biota; agents of pattern and change; methods and techniques for characterizing landscapes and detecting change; applications in resource conservation and management.
NOTE    Field trip fees may apply in certain years.
LEARNING HOURS    132 (36L;24Lb;72P)
basic.subject: GPHY
basic.title: Landscape Ecology

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisites    Level 4 & (6 fr BIOL;CHEM;PHYS) and (a GPA of 1.90 in 30 units fr GPHYorBIOLorENSC) & (GPA of 1.90 in 30 from GPHY;BIOL;ENSC) & (reg in GPHY;BIOL;ENSC Maj [sci] or EGPY or EBIO Plan).
Equivalency    GPHY310.
